main_definition: Glucose is a simple sugar that serves as the primary source of energy for living organisms, especially in humans.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A type of carbohydrate found in nature
The sugar that is the main energy source for cells, especially brain cells
meanings_and_examples.example: When we eat foods containing glucose, our body breaks it down to fuel our cells.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in biochemistry and diabetes management
meanings_and_examples.example: Diabetics monitor their blood glucose levels regularly to manage their condition.

meanings_and_examples.definition: 'Glucose' as a colloquial expression for sweetness or sugariness of food
meanings_and_examples.example: This cake is so full of glucose, it will make your teeth hurt!
